landingSection.name: Christian Rodríguez
landingSection.description: Software Engineer - Full Stack Developer - Machine Learning

aboutSection.subtitle: Get to know me
aboutSection.title: About Me
aboutSection.description: I'm a software engineer from Costa Rica who's passionate about creating innovative solutions. I'm currently leveraging my skills at EY to develop blockchain-powered applications that tackle complex business challenges. I'm also pursuing a Master's degree in Computer Science at the Universidad de Costa Rica with a focus on Machine Learning. I'm always eager to learn, create, and connect with people. In my free time, I enjoy playing sports, watching movies, and exploring new technologies.

softwareEngenieer.title: Software Engineer
softwareEngenieer.subtitle: Software Engenieer @ EY (2021 - Present)
softwareEngenieer.description1: I'm currently working on blockchain-based applications as a Software Engenieer at EY
softwareEngenieer.description2: I've been involved on the entire development cycle of a blockchain powered application, from the design of the architecture to the development of the application both in the backend and frontend.

machineLearning.title: Machine Learning
machineLearning.subtitle: Personal Projects  (2020 - Present)
machineLearning.description1: Ever since my third year of college, I've been captivated by the limitless potencial of machine learning. I am constantly exploring new ideas, reading research papers, watching tutorials and experimenting with different algorithms to expand my knowledge and improve my skills.
machineLearning.description2: My passion for machine learning has driven me to create several exiting projects in the areas of computer vision, and natural language processing. I am eager to take on new challenges and apply my knowledge to solve real world problems.

projectsSection.subtitle: Somethings I'm proud of
projectsSection.title: Projects
projectsSection.description: I'm currently working on improve my documentation efforts. I will be sharing detailed documentation of my projects and experiences to provide insight into my work. Stay tuned for working demos and, if possible, video recordings to get a better understanding of my projects.

projects.title: Seizure Classification
projects.description: American Epilepsy Society Seizure Prediction Challenge, which consists in predicting seizures in intracranial EEG recordings. Particularly, we compared how a Visual Transformer (ViT) performed to other Machine Learning methods like Convolutional Neural Networks, Support Vector Machines, and Random Forest

projects.title: Vehicle Counting
projects.description: Built a system for real-time vehicle counting on video footage. We used YOLOv4 as our object detector and plugged in different trackers from the OpenCV Multitracker library and DeepSort. We compared how these trackers performed in different challenging road scenarios.

projects.title: Speech Recognition Evaluation
projects.description: Recollected and labeled (Label Studio) audio from the Costa Rica Legislative Assembly Youtube channel. Evaluated how different open source Transformer models performed on the dataset after being finetuned in Spanish from Costa Rica

projects.title: Robot Assistant
projects.description: Developed a perception and control system which can find and deliver certain objects in a room. This was done using QiBullet simulation and based on YOLO v4.

projects.title: Personal website
projects.description: You are looking at it right now.

contactSection.title: Get in touch
contactSection.description: I'm always open to discussing new projects, creative ideas, or opportunities to be part of your vision.
